segment.source: Deploy Windows faster on the factory floor by using the Full Flash Update (FFU) image format.
segment.target: Deploy Windows faster on the factory floor by using the Full Flash Update (FFU) image format.

segment.source: Deploy Windows using Full Flash Update (FFU)
segment.target: Deploy Windows using Full Flash Update (FFU)

segment.source: Deploy Windows using Full Flash Update (FFU)
segment.target: Deploy Windows using Full Flash Update (FFU)

segment.source: Deploy Windows faster on the factory floor by using the Full Flash Update (FFU) image format.
segment.target: Deploy Windows faster on the factory floor by using the Full Flash Update (FFU) image format.

segment.source: With FFU images, you can apply a Windows image directly to a drive or an SD card, laying down the entire drive at once, including the partition information.
segment.target: With FFU images, you can apply a Windows image directly to a drive or an SD card, laying down the entire drive at once, including the partition information.

segment.source: To create and apply images, you can use Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).
segment.target: To create and apply images, you can use Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).

segment.source: You can also use the Windows 10 version of DISM to apply FFU images, which is included in the Windows 10 version of Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE).
segment.target: You can also use the Windows 10 version of DISM to apply FFU images, which is included in the Windows 10 version of Windows Preinstallation Environment (WinPE).

segment.source: Once you've created an FFU image, it can't be modified or edited offline.
segment.target: Once you've created an FFU image, it can't be modified or edited offline.

segment.source: To use Compact OS with an FFU image, you must prepare the original FFU image as a compressed image.
segment.target: To use Compact OS with an FFU image, you must prepare the original FFU image as a compressed image.

segment.source: FFU images are often too large to fit on a standard WinPE FAT32-formatted USB flash drive.
segment.target: FFU images are often too large to fit on a standard WinPE FAT32-formatted USB flash drive.

segment.source: To get around this, you can either use a separate storage drive or network location, or you can split the image into smaller .SFU files.
segment.target: To get around this, you can either use a separate storage drive or network location, or you can split the image into smaller .SFU files.

segment.source: Using FFUs
segment.target: Using FFUs

segment.source: To create an FFU image
segment.target: To create an FFU image

segment.source: On your technician PC, open Windows ICD and create your project.
segment.target: On your technician PC, open Windows ICD and create your project.

segment.source: Plug in a USB flash drive and note the drive letter (example: D:).
segment.target: Plug in a USB flash drive and note the drive letter (example: D:).

segment.source: Click CreateProduction MediaFFUEnable OS File Compression: (Yes or No) name the file, for example, D:install.ffu Build.
segment.target: Click CreateProduction MediaFFUEnable OS File Compression: (Yes or No) name the file, for example, D:install.ffu Build.

segment.source: To deploy Windows directly to an SD card or removable drive
segment.target: To deploy Windows directly to an SD card or removable drive

segment.source: From Windows ICD, click Deploy (either To USB connected device or To removable drive) Browse browse to the FFU image Next Select the SD card or device NextFlash.
segment.target: From Windows ICD, click Deploy (either To USB connected device or To removable drive) Browse browse to the FFU image Next Select the SD card or device NextFlash.

segment.source: If you're deploying to SD cards, then after the flashing process is finished, insert the SD card into your target device.
segment.target: If you're deploying to SD cards, then after the flashing process is finished, insert the SD card into your target device.

segment.source: To deploy Windows from WinPE
segment.target: To deploy Windows from WinPE

segment.source: Boot your destination device to WinPE.
segment.target: Boot your destination device to WinPE.

segment.source: Connect a storage drive or a network location and note the drive letter, for example, N.
segment.target: Connect a storage drive or a network location and note the drive letter, for example, N.

segment.source: Identify the drive to which you'll be applying the image.
segment.target: Identify the drive to which you'll be applying the image.

segment.source: You can use diskpart, or add Windows PowerShell support to WinPE and use Get-Disk for scriptability and more complex setups such as a server with multiple disks.
segment.target: You can use diskpart, or add Windows PowerShell support to WinPE and use Get-Disk for scriptability and more complex setups such as a server with multiple disks.

segment.source: Apply the image to a drive.
segment.target: Apply the image to a drive.

segment.source: For a physical drive X:, the string should be the following form: ".PhysicalDriveX", where X is the disk number that diskpart provides, such as .PhysicalDrive0.
segment.target: For a physical drive X:, the string should be the following form: ".PhysicalDriveX", where X is the disk number that diskpart provides, such as .PhysicalDrive0.

segment.source: Hard disk numbers start at zero.
segment.target: Hard disk numbers start at zero.

segment.source: For more information about PhysicalDriveX, see CreateFile function.
segment.target: For more information about PhysicalDriveX, see CreateFile function.

segment.source: To use a single drive for both WinPE and an FFU image
segment.target: To use a single drive for both WinPE and an FFU image

segment.source: Split the FFU image into smaller files:
segment.target: Split the FFU image into smaller files:

segment.source: Copy the files to the WinPE USB key.
segment.target: Copy the files to the WinPE USB key.

segment.source: Boot your destination device to WinPE.
segment.target: Boot your destination device to WinPE.

segment.source: Identify the letter of the Windows PE drive, for example, E.
segment.target: Identify the letter of the Windows PE drive, for example, E.

segment.source: While in the diskpart menu, identify the drive to which you'll be applying the image, for example, .PhysicalDrive0.
segment.target: While in the diskpart menu, identify the drive to which you'll be applying the image, for example, .PhysicalDrive0.

segment.source: Apply the image to a drive.
segment.target: Apply the image to a drive.

segment.source: To use a previous version of WinPE
segment.target: To use a previous version of WinPE

segment.source: Plug in a WinPE USB key and note the drive letter, for example, E.
segment.target: Plug in a WinPE USB key and note the drive letter, for example, E.

segment.source: Add the Windows 10 version of DISM to the WinPE drive.
segment.target: Add the Windows 10 version of DISM to the WinPE drive.

segment.source: To learn more, see Copy DISM to Another Computer.
segment.target: To learn more, see Copy DISM to Another Computer.

segment.source: Boot the destination device using the Windows PE USB key.
segment.target: Boot the destination device using the Windows PE USB key.

segment.source: Identify the letter of the drive where the FFU is stored, for example, E.
segment.target: Identify the letter of the drive where the FFU is stored, for example, E.

segment.source: While in the diskpart menu, identify the drive to which you'll be applying the image, for example, .PhysicalDrive0.
segment.target: While in the diskpart menu, identify the drive to which you'll be applying the image, for example, .PhysicalDrive0.

segment.source: Install the Windows 10 version of DISM.
segment.target: Install the Windows 10 version of DISM.

segment.source: Apply the image to a drive.
segment.target: Apply the image to a drive.
